project_overview.name: Windows 11 Web Sim
project_overview.design_persona: E1 (Anti-AI Designer) - Focusing on 'Fusion over Imitation' but heavily grounded in 'Authenticity' for this specific simulation task.

mica_effect.description: Simulates Windows 11 Mica material. Use for main app windows.

acrylic_effect.description: Simulates Windows 11 Acrylic. Use for Taskbar and Start Menu.

glass_panel.description: For internal panels or cards within the OS.

layout.grid_system: Use absolute positioning for Desktop Icons and Windows (simulated window manager). Use Flexbox/Grid for internal window layouts.

Taskbar.style: fixed bottom-0 left-0 right-0 h-12 bg-[#202020]/80 backdrop-blur-2xl flex justify-center items-center z-50 border-t border-white/5
Taskbar.instructions: Icons must be centered. Start button on the left of the center group. System tray on the far right.

StartMenu.style: fixed bottom-14 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 w-[600px] h-[700px] bg-[#202020]/85 backdrop-blur-3xl rounded-xl border border-white/10 shadow-2xl z-50 overflow-hidden flex flex-col animate-in slide-in-from-bottom-5 fade-in duration-200
StartMenu.instructions: Contains Pinned Apps grid (top) and Recommended files list (bottom). Search bar at the very top. User profile and Power button at the very bottom.

Window.style: absolute bg-[#202020]/95 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-xl border border-white/10 shadow-2xl overflow-hidden flex flex-col
Window.instructions: Must have a TitleBar (draggable handle), Content Area, and Resize handles (optional). Use framer-motion for drag constraints.

DesktopIcon.style: flex flex-col items-center gap-1 w-20 p-2 rounded hover:bg-white/5 transition-colors cursor-pointer group
DesktopIcon.instructions: Icon (32px or 48px) + Text Label (text-xs text-center text-white drop-shadow-md).

LockScreen.style: fixed inset-0 z-[100] bg-cover bg-center flex flex-col items-center justify-center text-white transition-all duration-500
LockScreen.instructions: Shows large Time/Date. On click, slides up or fades to show Login Form (Glassmorphism card).

icons.instructions: Use specific Lucide icons to mimic Windows: 'LayoutGrid' for Start, 'Search' for Search, 'AppWindow' for Task view, 'Folder' for Explorer.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is pure white (#FFFFFF) on dark mica backgrounds.

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. Global CSS: Add the custom CSS variables for 'mica' and 'acrylic' backgrounds in index.css if Tailwind classes aren't enough (though backdrop-blur usually works).
3. State Management: You MUST create a Context ('OSContext') to manage: 'currentRole' (admin/user), 'isLocked' (bool), 'openWindows' (array of objects), 'activeWindow' (id).
4. Component Structure: Create a layout wrapper that conditionally renders 'LockScreen' or 'Desktop'.
5. Desktop: The Desktop component should render the 'Taskbar' and a map of 'Window' components from the 'openWindows' state.
6. Windows 11 Logic: The 'Start Menu' is a toggle. Clicking outside it closes it. It is NOT a window, it's a floating overlay.
7. Admin Panel: This is just another 'Window' component but with restricted access. If currentRole !== 'admin', it should not open or show an error.
8. Broadcast: This is a full-screen overlay with high z-index (z-[9999]) that mimics a BSOD or System Alert.
9. File Explorer: Use a simple mock data structure for folders. Breadcrumbs are essential for the Win11 look.
10. CMD: Use a simple input loop. Parse commands 'help', 'cls', 'time', 'echo'.
11. DO NOT use generic Shadcn cards for Windows. Build custom 'Window' frames using the 'visual_enhancers' styles.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. Avoid this.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors: separates good from extraordinary.
Never use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤– etc.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable, but CUSTOMIZE them for the Windows 11 look.
